group_1.narration: Komachi brought something absolutely gobsmacking@into the club room.

group_1.textRight: Why, that's a first-hand historical source.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, really! It was stored in the museum's archives@this whole time.
See, after our recent shoot there...

group_1.narration: —Mikura—@They told me that they had a lot of unsorted documents,@which they let me see.
—Mikura—@And one of them was Tsukihiko's diary—@from right when he was getting acquainted with Ruri, no less.

group_1.textLeft: And this right here...@is the copy they let me make!
I bet this can tell us what Tsukihiko was really@thinking about.
You're done already?!@I thought it was a pretty tough style to read.

group_1.textRight: It's easier than Ogai's "The Dancing Girl."

group_1.textLeft: ...Oh. Right. You're the sort of person who can read@classical Japanese without breaking a sweat.

group_1.textRight: Now that we've found such a crucial font of@information...
This calls for a script revision.@Let's change the ending.

group_1.textLeft: Oh? I thought as much... Really, I kind of had trouble@deciding whether or not to even show it to you.

group_1.textRight: You made the right choice in showing me.
We can't change the outcome of a true story... but I@think this will make it much more satisfying.

group_1.textLeft: I feel like a revision this late in the game will affect@several other things...
...so we should contact Mihono about this too...

group_1.textRight: No, there's no need. In fact, I'd like to try keeping it@a secret.
Everyone's script will be the same, apart from the@very last moment.
And if our heroine doesn't know the truth, wouldn't@it be more...?

group_1.textLeft: ...Yeah. If the diary's any indication, at least.
I feel guilty about deciding that by ourselves,@though...

group_1.textRight: Don't worry. I'm sure we can pull it off.
Now, let's strike while the iron is hot.
I'm going to get to work on the script revision right@away.

group_1.textLeft: Okay. It's in your hands, Kira.
